definition: to pass one's days/to scratch out a difficult, meager existence
to pass/to spend (time)/measure/limit/extent/degree of intensity/degree (angles, temperature etc)/kilowatt-hour/classifier for events and occurrences
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
a day drags past like a year (idiom); time hangs heavy/time crawls when one is wretched

sentences.english: You find it difficult to get things done or even at least get through the day.
sentences.chinese: 你會感覺很難把事情做好，甚至度日如年。

sentences.english: Problem with Orphans A gang of orphans scoured the city for scraps to live on.
sentences.chinese: 孤兒問題一羣孤兒在城裏四處搜索殘羹剩飯混時度日。

sentences.english: Like a little hamster, who once spend his days in a RV pank.
sentences.chinese: 比如一隻小倉鼠，每天都只能在一個旅行車場度日。

sentences.english: It's been so quiet since you've gone, And everyday feels more like a year.
sentences.chinese: 你離開後生活如此平靜，而我竟覺度日如年。

sentences.english: Many would live by their wits, but break for want of stock.
sentences.chinese: 許多人都想靠小聰明度日，卻因缺乏實力而無以爲繼。

sentences.english: Let a man who does not wish to become slothful, fall in love.
sentences.chinese: 讓不願懶散度日的男人沈醉於愛情吧。

sentences.english: A difficult boss can make your time at work miserable.
sentences.chinese: 一個難纏的上司會讓你覺得在工作時度日如年。

sentences.english: Aunt Marcia spent years bowed down with grief after the death of her husband.
sentences.chinese: 馬西婭大嬸自從丈夫死後，多年來一直在悲傷中度日。

sentences.english: When he was too old to work, he had to beg for food to stay alive.
sentences.chinese: 當他老得不能幹活的時候，只好乞食度日。

sentences.english: I'm counting the seconds until the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 我度日如年地盼望着週末的到來。

sentences.english: The black king in ice on a non-working cannot help keep call spittor king.
sentences.chinese: 黑大王在冰牢度日如年，忍不住不停地召喚金蟾大王。

sentences.english: Many are just scrambling along in the world.
sentences.chinese: 世界上許多人只是勉強度日而已。

sentences.english: Feel one day like one year at that time. Now my body is very good.
sentences.chinese: 去年我在醫院度日如年，如今身體棒的很。

sentences.english: Having unpleasant neighbours can make one's life an absolute misery.
sentences.chinese: 鄰居不好也能叫人度日如年。

sentences.english: Later his parents died, he was followed by his brother.
sentences.chinese: 後來父母去世，他便跟着哥嫂度日。

sentences.english: He was from a big poor family and managed to make ends meet by doing multiple odd jobs.
sentences.chinese: 他出身於一個貧窮的大家庭，靠做多份零工勉強度日。

definition: to live one's life/to make a living
to subsist/to eke out a living/to keep body and soul together
lit. food not filling the stomach (idiom)/fig. poverty-stricken
to live one's life/to pass one's days/to get along
at dawn, not sure of lasting to evening (idiom); precarious state/imminent crisis/living from hand to mouth
to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
